## VoicemailPlayer() function

Given a function that renders an <audio> element as `children`<!-- -->, renders a React element that displays the audio's amplitude peaks, current time / duration, and allows to control the audio playback (currently Play / Pause, and Seek)

**Signature:**

```typescript
export default function VoicemailPlayer({ children, className, barAlignment, barWidth, barGap, barRadius, }: VoicemailPlayerProps): React.JSX.Element;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  { children, className, barAlignment, barWidth, barGap, barRadius, } | [VoicemailPlayerProps](./react-voicemail-player.voicemailplayerprops.md) |  |

**Returns:**

React.JSX.Element

React element

## Example


```ts
<VoicemailPlayer>{(ref) => <audio ref={ref} />}</VoicemailPlayer>
```
